Monster ID7795

Ancient Wyverns are Slayer monsters that require a Slayer level of 82 in order to be harmed. They reside in the Wyvern Cave on Fossil Island and are the strongest species of Wyvern in Old School RuneScape. Like with other Wyverns, an elemental, mind, dragonfire or ancient wyvern shield provides significant protection against their icy breath. These monsters require completion of the Bone Voyage quest to be assigned as a Slayer task.

In addition to being harder to fight, Ancient Wyverns share the ability with Taloned Wyverns to use an unblockable Ranged attack that resembles a lighter coloured Water Blast. This attack ignores Protection prayers and hits around 10, though they can also miss. They also appear to use all Melee attack types. When fighting them, the highest defensive armour the player can access is best suited to use against them. Should one choose to use range to fight them, it is recommended to fight in melee range and use Protect from Melee after de-aggroing the Wyverns.

Auto aggression can be removed if one gains aggression from one Wyvern, waits 10-15 minutes north of the third mushroom on the narrow high path, and then kills the aggroed Wyvern.

Drop rates estimated based on 623,117 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Ancient Wyvern kill is worth 21,760.17.

The average Ancient Wyvern kill while on a Konar task is worth 23,612.88.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 July 2018
(update | poll)

Ancient Wyverns now drop a maximum of 24 seaweed spores instead of 12.

18 January 2018
(update)

The Ancient Wyvern's Defence level has been reduced from 220 to 150, changing its combat level from 227 to 210.

8 September 2017
(update)

The Ancient Wyvern's drop table has been improved.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • They appear to use all attack styles when using melee, depending on the animation they use: slashing when they use their talons, stabbing when they jab with their tail and crushing when they bite the target.
  • Ancient wyverns had a festive override wearing a yellow partyhat during the 2017, 2018, and 2019 Christmas events.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Jagex. Mod Maz's Twitter account. 24 October 2017. (Archived from the original on 25 March 2019.) Mod Maz: "Fossil Island info! Granite LS/boots drop rates. From ancient: 1/600 each From normal: LS 1/512 Boots 1/2560"
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Maz's Twitter account. 9 October 2017. (Archived from the original on 25 March 2019.) Mod Maz: "Wyvern Visage is 1/12k for normals and 1/10k for ancients."
